intro: Ridsdalea macromera, commonly known as the giant ridsdalea, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Ridsdalea macromera thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in botanical gardens.
